author: Staff Reporter
text:
To ensure 100 per cent polling in all the six assembly constituencies in the district, short films explaining the importance of voting were screened through a hi-tech publicity van across the district.

The van, introduced by the Department of Information and Public Relations, would be used to screen documentaries, short films and messages related to election that stresses 100 per cent polling in the district.

Also, it encourages persons who have completed 18 years to enrol themselves in the electoral roll and ensure that they exercise their democratic rights.

District Electoral Officer and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy inaugurated the screening facility at the bus stand in the presence of Returning Officer for Namakkal Assembly Constituency and Revenue Divisional Officer M. Kannan, Namakkal Municipal Commissioner Senthil Kumar and other election officials. They also distributed awareness pamphlets to the public and asked them to vote without fail.

Message from Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhani, film artistes and sportspersons explaining the need to vote in a democratic society were screened through the hi-tech publicity van.

Also, street play videos and dance performance by students that stresses voting were also screened. The vehicle would screen the documentaries in public places, villages and other important places in the district.
title: Hi-tech van to screen short films on importance of voting
